channel.title: Volume Control for MacOS
channel.description: Most recent changes with links to updates.

item.title: Fake
item.description:
Fake version 1.7.3

More responsive acoustic feedback

  • When this option is enabled, the acoustic feedback plays the sound in a more responsive manner.

Version 1.7.2

Improved visualizaton of icon in menu bar

  • The icon in the menu bar now follows the guidelines of Big Sur and onwards
  • Improved control of system volume (more responsive)
  • Improved description of menus
  • Fixed various minor bugs

Version 1.7.0

Changed named to Volume Control

  • iTunes Volume Control has changed name. This update will install version 1.7.0 of the app in the application folder under the name Volume Control instead of the old name iTunes Volume Control. Please be aware that you need to start the new application Volume Control manually. The old application iTunes Volume Control can be deleted by dragging it in the trash bin.
  • Compatibility with Big Sur
  • Created universal bundle for both intel and new Apple M1
  • Tested with latest Spotify (1.1.61.583) and Music (1.1.5) versions

Version 1.6.8

1 improvement; 1 bug fix; 1 discontinued feature

  • With the command key modifier, you can now decide whether to control the system volume or the music player volume, with the same features (i.e., fine adjustment of volume, etc).
  • Improved detection of dark mode after bug reports have been filed.
  • Discontinued support for macOS High Sierra (10.13).

Version 1.6.7

Catalina compatibility:

  • Made it compatible with Catalina's new Music player.

Version 1.6.6

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to High Sierra are no longer supported.

Improvements:

  • Restored compatibility with MacOS High Sierra and subsequent versions.

Version 1.6.5

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Avoid launching iTunes and Spotify when starting the app, if these program are not already running.

Version 1.6.4

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of changes:

  • Bug fix: Fixed crashing at start occurring in versions after 1.5.1 by avoiding now to codesign the app.
  • Note: As of Mojave 10.14.5, users cannot run codesigned applications anymore, unless these are downloaded directly from the AppleStore or "notarized" by Apple. With the new MacOS, Catalina, this policy will be strictly enforced.
  • Improvement: Added a dedicated dialog window with instructions how to authorize the app to control the volume keys, and better handling of permission requests to execute AppleEvents.

Version 1.6.2

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed a bug preventing Spotify's volume to be controlled.

Version 1.6.1

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of improvements:

  • Improved visualization of volume status using even marks.

Version 1.6.0

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of new features:

  • You can now control iTunes, Spotify and the global volume.
  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

List of improvements:

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

List of changes:

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

Back compatibility

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

Version 1.5

New features

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Missing feature

  • Implementing the Yosemite look when displaying the volume indicator. If anybody has some ideas, I will be very glad to hear to implement the new vibrant look!

    • Bug fixes

  • Added backward compatibility with Mavericks and then also Yosemite.
  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

item.title: Version 1.7.3 (bug fix)
item.description:
Version 1.7.3

More responsive acoustic feedback

  • When this option is enabled, the acoustic feedback plays the sound in a more responsive manner.

Version 1.7.2

Improved visualizaton of icon in menu bar

  • The icon in the menu bar now follows the guidelines of Big Sur and onwards
  • Improved control of system volume (more responsive)
  • Improved description of menus
  • Fixed various minor bugs

Version 1.7.0

Changed named to Volume Control

  • iTunes Volume Control has changed name. This update will install version 1.7.0 of the app in the application folder under the name Volume Control instead of the old name iTunes Volume Control. Please be aware that you need to start the new application Volume Control manually. The old application iTunes Volume Control can be deleted by dragging it in the trash bin.
  • Compatibility with Big Sur
  • Created universal bundle for both intel and new Apple M1
  • Tested with latest Spotify (1.1.61.583) and Music (1.1.5) versions

Version 1.6.8

1 improvement; 1 bug fix; 1 discontinued feature

  • With the command key modifier, you can now decide whether to control the system volume or the music player volume, with the same features (i.e., fine adjustment of volume, etc).
  • Improved detection of dark mode after bug reports have been filed.
  • Discontinued support for macOS High Sierra (10.13).

Version 1.6.7

Catalina compatibility:

  • Made it compatible with Catalina's new Music player.

Version 1.6.6

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to High Sierra are no longer supported.

Improvements:

  • Restored compatibility with MacOS High Sierra and subsequent versions.

Version 1.6.5

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Avoid launching iTunes and Spotify when starting the app, if these program are not already running.

Version 1.6.4

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of changes:

  • Bug fix: Fixed crashing at start occurring in versions after 1.5.1 by avoiding now to codesign the app.
  • Note: As of Mojave 10.14.5, users cannot run codesigned applications anymore, unless these are downloaded directly from the AppleStore or "notarized" by Apple. With the new MacOS, Catalina, this policy will be strictly enforced.
  • Improvement: Added a dedicated dialog window with instructions how to authorize the app to control the volume keys, and better handling of permission requests to execute AppleEvents.

Version 1.6.2

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed a bug preventing Spotify's volume to be controlled.

Version 1.6.1

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of improvements:

  • Improved visualization of volume status using even marks.

Version 1.6.0

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of new features:

  • You can now control iTunes, Spotify and the global volume.
  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

List of improvements:

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

List of changes:

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

Back compatibility

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

Version 1.5

New features

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Missing feature

  • Implementing the Yosemite look when displaying the volume indicator. If anybody has some ideas, I will be very glad to hear to implement the new vibrant look!

    • Bug fixes

  • Added backward compatibility with Mavericks and then also Yosemite.
  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

  • Note: As of Mojave 10.14.5, users cannot run codesigned applications anymore, unless these are downloaded directly from the AppleStore or "notarized" by Apple. With the new MacOS, Catalina, this policy will be strictly enforced.

Bug fixes:

Version 1.6.1

List of improvements:

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Bug fixes

  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    New feature

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • Other minor bug fixes.

  • Improved visualization of volume status using even marks.

Version 1.6.0

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of new features:

  • You can now control iTunes, Spotify and the global volume.
  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

List of improvements:

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

List of changes:

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

Back compatibility

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

Version 1.5

New features

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Missing feature

  • Implementing the Yosemite look when displaying the volume indicator. If anybody has some ideas, I will be very glad to hear to implement the new vibrant look!

    • Bug fixes

  • Added backward compatibility with Mavericks and then also Yosemite.
  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

item.title: Version 1.6.6 (1 improvement)
item.description:
Version 1.6.6

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to High Sierra are no longer supported.

Improvements:

  • Restored compatibility with MacOS High Sierra and subsequent versions.

Version 1.6.5

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Avoid launching iTunes and Spotify when starting the app, if these program are not already running.

Version 1.6.4

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of changes:

  • Bug fix: Fixed crashing at start occurring in versions after 1.5.1 by avoiding now to codesign the app.
  • Note: As of Mojave 10.14.5, users cannot run codesigned applications anymore, unless these are downloaded directly from the AppleStore or "notarized" by Apple. With the new MacOS, Catalina, this policy will be strictly enforced.
  • Improvement: Added a dedicated dialog window with instructions how to authorize the app to control the volume keys, and better handling of permission requests to execute AppleEvents.

Version 1.6.2

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed a bug preventing Spotify's volume to be controlled.

Version 1.6.1

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of improvements:

  • Improved visualization of volume status using even marks.

List of new features:

  • You can now control iTunes, Spotify and the global volume.
  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

List of improvements:

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

Back compatibility

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

Version 1.5

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Missing feature

  • Implementing the Yosemite look when displaying the volume indicator. If anybody has some ideas, I will be very glad to hear to implement the new vibrant look!

    • Bug fixes

  • Added backward compatibility with Mavericks and then also Yosemite.
  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

item.title: Version 1.6.3 (1 bug fix, 1 improvement)
item.description:
Version 1.6.3

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of changes:

  • Fixed crashing at start occurring in versions after 1.5.1 by avoiding codesigning. In fact, since as of Mojave 10.14.5, users cannot run codesigned applications anymore, unless these are downloaded directly from the AppleStore or "notarized" by Apple.
  • Added a dedicated dialog instructing the users how to authorize the app to control the volume keys.

Version 1.6.2

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed a bug preventing Spotify's volume to be controlled.

Version 1.6.1

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of improvements:

  • Improved visualization of volume status using even marks.

List of new features:

  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

List of changes:

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

    • Missing feature

    • Bug fixes

  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.

item.title: Version 1.6.0 (2 new features)
item.description:
Version 1.6.0

Important notifications:

  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

List of new features:

  • You can now control iTunes, Spotify and the global volume.
  • You can hide the volume status display, which is useful when watching a movie, for example.

Version 1.5.3

List of improvements:

  • The native heads-up display of Mojave is used to show the volume bar.

Version 1.5.2

List of changes:

  • Fixed compatibility with Mojave.
  • MacOS versions prior to Mojave are no longer supported.

Version 1.5.1

Back compatibility

  • Added compatibility with OS X versions greater than Mac OS X 10.7 (Lion).

Version 1.5

New features

  • Support dark and light theme in Yosemite.
  • Added the possibility to select the increment size of the volume in percentage.

    • Missing feature

  • Implementing the Yosemite look when displaying the volume indicator. If anybody has some ideas, I will be very glad to hear to implement the new vibrant look!

    • Bug fixes

  • Added backward compatibility with Mavericks and then also Yosemite.
  • Internal timers are now fired also when the status menu is active.

    • Version 1.4.10

    Bug fixes

  • Fixed problem at startup when the app is not responding.
  • Fixed problem with position of the volume indicator on the screen after changing the display resolution.
  • Repositioned the volume indicator in the new position of Yosemite. This breaks compatibility with Mavericks.

    • Version 1.4.9

    Fixed permament highlight in statusbar

    • Removed bug when the icon in the status bar reimained always highlighted after clicking.

    Version 1.4.8

    Security improvements

    • Next updates will be signed with DSA (digital signature algorithm).

    Version 1.4.7

    New feature

    • Icons and graphical interface are now compatible with retina displays.

    Version 1.4.6

    New feature

    • Added the option to hide the icon from status bar, which can be convenient when many icons are already present. The icon reappears temporarily (for 10 seconds) by simply restarting the application. This gives the time to change the hide behavior as desired. The credits must go to Thomas He√ü.

    Version 1.4.5

    New feature

    • Added the option to enable/disable automatic updates occurring once a week.

    Version 1.4.4

    Bug Fixes

    • The window focus remains on the currently active application after changing iTunes' volume setting.
    • The cap lock does not prevent anymore iTunes' volume to be changed.

    Version 1.4.3

    Bug Fixes

    • Properly hide transparent panels when animations are completed (thanks to Justin Kerr Sheckler).

    Version 1.4.2

    New Features

    • Added the iTunes icon on the volume display panel in order to distinguish it from the system volume indicator.

    Bug Fixes

    • Removed an annoying bug occurring when iTunes was busy syncing/starting. The app regains normal control after iTunes becomes again available.

    Version 1.4.1

    New Features

    • Added the ability to check for new updates.

    Bug Fixes

    • The volume indicator now stays always on top.
    • Fixed bug when pressing simultaneously the two volume keys.
    • Other minor bug fixes.
